intro: Layia neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Layia neomexicana is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
